name: tagged
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a tag (= a piece of metal or plastic or an electronic device that is fastened to a person, animal, or object, so that people can know where they are or it is, or get other information about them or it): A group of neatly tagged pieces of evidence lay on the table. He is electronically tagged and not allowed out at night. The receiver will pick up a signal from tagged sharks that pass within about a half-mile radius.
computing
  specialized Tagged computer information has been marked to be dealt with in a particular way: The architecture uses tagged data types. Relevant data can be lost because of wrongly tagged items. Compare
untagged
More examplesFewer examplesLoose baggage tagged for loading onto flights was left behind.A reader can extract location and product description data from a tagged item every 250 milliseconds.Tagged criminals have their movements constantly monitored.Terminal tagged elements are those whose sub-elements have a basic type and do not have attributes.This view is more natural than pure HTML code but still exposes the tagged structure.
